definition: warm/lukewarm/temperature/to warm up/mild/soft/tender/to review (a lesson etc)/fever (TCM)/old variant of 瘟[wen1]
thick/deep or profound/kind/generous/rich or strong in flavor/to favor/to stress

sentences.english: The mild Mr. Tyson was completely foxed by his wife.
sentences.chinese: 溫厚的泰森先生被他妻子徹底矇騙了。

sentences.english: That bonhomie is perhaps most clearly felt by the city’s artists.
sentences.chinese: 藝術家們最清楚地感受到了這個城市的溫厚和敦良。

sentences.english: Vardalos' good- natured and eccentric family encouraged the youngster' s creativity.
sentences.chinese: 她溫厚而又古怪的家人對她的創造力給予了鼓勵。

sentences.english: Malloy always talked hard, but he had a soft , womanish face.
sentences.chinese: 馬洛伊說話很嚴厲，但有一張溫厚的女人似的臉。

sentences.english: To do him justice, he is a good-natured m an.
sentences.chinese: 說句公道話，他是一個溫厚的人。

sentences.english: "He upset you, didn't he?" Melly asked gently.
sentences.chinese: “他騷擾你了，是嗎？”梅利溫厚問道。

definition: cultured and refined (idiom); gentle and cultivated
properly/satisfactorily/firmly/very fitting/appropriate/proper/to be in good order/also written 妥帖
one's four limbs/two arms and two legs
(of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
receptive as an echoing canyon (idiom); modest and open-minded
